{"title":"page 38","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"38
who, in the presence of the police officer or policeman, may threaten the life of any person, or to
burn his house, or to commit any felony, or any
person armed with any offensive weapon, with intent therewith to commit a felony. He should
also arrest any persqn found in any building,
whether inhabited or not, or in any yard or garden,
under such circumstances as give just cause to
suspect that he is there with any felonious purpose.
In these, and similar cases, Police Officers must
judge from all the circumstances of the case, what
the intention of the party is. In some cases,
doubt can exist—as when the party is a notorious
thief, or acting with those who are known ti
thieves; or when the party is attempting to break
into a house, or is examining the doors and windows, or endeavoring to take property secretly.
If the intention of the party admits of doubt, the
Police Officer will not act hastily, but will closely
watch tho suspected party, that he may discover
his design.
POWER TO ARREST FOR FELONY.
Sec 10. A Police Officer must make every exertion to effect the arrest of any one he may see","fullrs":{},"find":"2677.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2676","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"444689","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.42 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
